intro: Verbascum bugulifolium, commonly known as the narrow-leaf mullein, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It belongs to the family Scrophulariaceae and is characterized by its fuzzy, gray-green leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
